title: Bazel@HEAD failed to build Bazel with remote execution and `--experimental_remote_merkle_tree_cache`

labels.name: team-Remote-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Remote) team

body:
### Description of the bug:


The error messages maybe different, but they all point to the missing of runfiles:

```
ERROR: /usr/local/google/home/chiwang/dev/github/bazelbuild/bazel/BUILD:187:8: Writing: bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/rules_java-srcs.tar failed: (Exit 1): build_tar failed: error executing PackageTar command (from target //:rules_java-srcs) bazel-out/k8-opt-exec-ST-778d9d0c251b/bin/external/rules_pkg~/pkg/private/tar/build_tar '--output=bazel-out/k8-opt/bin/rules_java-srcs.tar' '--mode=0555' '--owner=0.0' '--owner_name=.' '--directory=/' ... (remaining 2 arguments skipped)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "bazel-out/k8-opt-exec-ST-778d9d0c251b/bin/external/rules_pkg~/pkg/private/tar/build_tar", line 559, in <module>
    Main()
  File "bazel-out/k8-opt-exec-ST-778d9d0c251b/bin/external/rules_pkg~/pkg/private/tar/build_tar", line 457, in Main
    module_space = FindModuleSpace(main_rel_path)
  File "bazel-out/k8-opt-exec-ST-778d9d0c251b/bin/external/rules_pkg~/pkg/private/tar/build_tar", line 172, in FindModuleSpace
    raise AssertionError('Cannot find .runfiles directory for %s' % sys.argv[0])
AssertionError: Cannot find .runfiles directory for bazel-out/k8-opt-exec-ST-778d9d0c251b/bin/external/rules_pkg~/pkg/private/tar/build_tar
```

### Which category does this issue belong to?

_No response_

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


1. Clone https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel
2. Run `USE_BAZEL_VERSION=last_green bazel build --config=remote --experimental_remote_merkle_tree_cache --noremote_accept_cached -- //src:bazel`
